BR_text.BRdescription:
I am running Python 3.6.8 (Anaconda) and when I pip install label-studio I get this error message:
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: jupyter-console 6.0.0 has requirement prompt_toolkit<2.1.0,>=2.0.0, but you'll have prompt-toolkit 1.0.14 which is incompatible.
 ERROR: ipython 7.11.1 has requirement prompt-toolkit!=3.0.0,!=3.0.1,<3.1.0,>=2.0.0, but you'll have prompt-toolkit 1.0.14 which is incompatible.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 This then uninstalls prompt-toolkit-3.0.2 and installs prompt-toolkit-1.0.14
 After this, ipython and jupyter notebook are unusable and terminate with
 <denchmark-code>ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'prompt_toolkit.formatted_text'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 On the other hand if I install ipython properly with the required dependency, label-studio terminates with
 <denchmark-code>from prompt_toolkit.token import Token
 </denchmark-code>
 
 I guess it would be useful to upgrade to the more recent version of prompt-toolkit as it would be important to be able to use label-studio in the same environment as ipython.

comments_0.comment_text:
Hi, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/johann-petrak>@johann-petrak</denchmark-link>
  ! Thanks for reporting this. I believe the issue has gone now. Please try again updating to the latest version  and feedback us please if everything is OK so we can close this issue

comments_1.comment_text: Thanks, this appears to work for me now!

comments_2.comment_text: Damn, that was quick. Can confirm, work for me too.
